page.title: 08Barry Boys School Cont
page.content: They are usually examined by the Welsh Joint Education Committee. Pupils are entered for as many subjects as they can reasonably cope with and at a level considred appropriate to their ability. General Certificate 'O' leel and, Certificate in secondary Education examinations are sat at the end of year 5 and G.C.E. A-level examinations at the end of the 7th year. Decisions on examination entries are the final responsibility of the Headteacher following consultation with teachers and parents. Some pupils choose link courses with the college of Further Education preparing for city and Guilds foundation courses, certificate of further education and examinations for the Business Education Council General Certificate.
